Arshad Topi, the lover, is now a target, seeking police protection as the gang seeks revenge, suspecting foul play in the woman's death. Police are on high alert to prevent further violence.

title: Reuters X handle blocked in India over 'legal demand'
description: Reuters' main X account has been withheld in India following a legal demand, according to a notice on the platform. Government sources deny issuing any new demand recently, citing a previous request during "Operation Sindoor" that led to the blocking of numerous accounts. X, formerly Twitter, appears to have acted on this older request, while affiliated Reuters accounts remain accessible.

title: 'Not against Hindi': Sanjay Raut distances from Stalin's 'support'
description: Sanjay Raut clarifies Shiv Sena (UBT)'s stance on Hindi, distinguishing it from Tamil Nadu's outright rejection. Maharashtra opposes mandatory Hindi in primary schools, not the language itself, unlike the southern state's broader resistance.

title: Honeymoon nightmare: Newly-weds duped of Rs 7.6L for Europe trip
description: A newly-wed couple from Kolkata was allegedly cheated by a travel agency. They lost Rs 7.6 lakh. The agency cancelled their Europe honeymoon trip just before the wedding. Police are investigating the fraud. Similar scams have occurred recently. Authorities advise caution when booking travel packages. Verify agency credentials and avoid full advance payments. Report suspicious offers to the police.

title: 'How Epaminondas beat Spartans': Musk launches 'America Party' to fight 'uniparty'
description: Elon Musk has announced the formation of 'The America Party,' inspired by ancient Greek military strategy, aiming to disrupt the perceived 'uniparty' system in American politics. Musk criticized President Trump's tax-cut and spending bill, labeling it "debt slavery," and vowed to challenge the status quo. He also hinted at a potential run for office next year.

title: ‘Was forced to bury bodies for years’: Karnataka ex-sanitation worker’s chilling claim
description: A former sanitation worker in Dharmasthala has filed a police complaint, alleging he was coerced into secretly disposing of multiple dead bodies over several years. He claims to have exhumed skeletal remains from burial sites, submitting photographs as evidence.

title: IND v ENG: Big milestone! Rishabh Pant scripts SENA history with explosive knock
description: Rishabh Pant etched his name in cricket history, becoming the first Asian wicketkeeper-batter to surpass 2,000 Test runs in SENA countries. His aggressive 65 in the Edgbaston Test against England underscored his impact. Pant's Edgbaston innings also saw him break the record for most sixes by a visiting batter in England, with 24 sixes.

title: ‘Hidden camera linked to Wi-Fi’: Lucknow landlord booked for spying in tenant's bathroom
description: In Lucknow, a landlord faces accusations of installing a hidden camera in his female tenant's bathroom, allegedly connecting it to Wi-Fi for live viewing. The tenant discovered the device on June 24th. Upon confronting the landlord, she alleges he attempted to rape her and threatened her family if she reported the incident.

title: Man ends life over wife's character, unaware she died earlier; children orphaned
description: In a tragic turn of events in Patiala, Gurmeet Singh died by suicide, unaware that his wife, Manpreet Kaur, had already taken her own life days earlier due to constant quarrels and his unfounded suspicions. Manpreet left home with their children after an argument, and her body was later found in the Bhakra canal.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs’ Europe trip; drops cryptic 3-word message
description: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: US-India trade deal: Industry ready for any outcome, says CII chief
description: As the deadline for US-imposed reciprocal tariffs approaches, Indian industry prepares for any outcome from trade talks. CII President Rajiv Memani emphasizes India's commitment to national interests, stating that any agreement must benefit both nations. While a deal could boost sectors like IT and pharma, failure may impact automotive and garment industries, highlighting the need for enhanced competitiveness.

title: Watch: Swimmers narrowly escape falling boulders at Utah waterfall
description: A shocking incident at Utah's Lower Calf Creek Falls saw swimmers narrowly escape injury when large boulders suddenly crashed down near them. The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) Utah video went viral, highlighting the dangers of the popular swimming spot. While no one was hurt in this incident, authorities are urging caution due to the risk of falling rocks.

title: AI robots fill in for weed killers and farm hands
description: Oblivious to the punishing midday heat, a wheeled robot powered by the sun and infused with artificial intelligence carefully combs a cotton field in California, plucking out weeds. - Aigen has robots running in tomato, cotton, and sugar beet fields, and touts the technology's ability to weed without damaging the crops.

title: 'Blessed by his presence in our country': Rijiju attends Dalai Lama’s 90th birthday
description: Union minister Kiren Rijiju attended the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations in Dharamshala, emphasizing his role as a bridge between ancient wisdom and the modern world. The Dalai Lama reflected on benefiting others from exile in India. Amid succession debates, Rijiju affirmed India's support for the Dalai Lama's institution's decisions, rejecting external interference, particularly from China.

title: Musk launches ‘America Party’: Can he run for president in 2028?
description: Elon Musk has unveiled his 'America Party,' challenging the existing two-party system amidst a strained relationship with Donald Trump. Despite constitutional ineligibility for the presidency due to his African birth, Musk aims to disrupt the political landscape. A recent poll on X revealed strong public support for a new party, prompting Musk to action.

title: Tourists may soon have to pre-register Mussoorie trip
description: To combat overcrowding and traffic congestion, Dehradun authorities plan to introduce a pre-registration system for tourists visiting Mussoorie during peak seasons. The system, prompted by a doubling of visitors between 2022 and 2024, will require tourists to register online and obtain a QR code for entry. Those without valid registration may be denied access at key checkpoints.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant silences Harry Brook’s ‘fastest 100’ quip - WATCH
description: During the Edgbaston Test, England's Harry Brook attempted to unsettle Rishabh Pant with playful sledging, questioning his fastest century. Pant, unfazed, responded calmly, focusing on his game. He then scored a crucial 65 off 58 balls, contributing to a significant partnership with Shubman Gill, who made 161.

title: Plane violates restriction above Trump's golf course; escorted out by F-16
description: A NORAD fighter jet intercepted a civilian aircraft that violated restricted airspace over Bedminster, New Jersey, where President Trump was celebrating the 4th of July weekend. The incident, which occurred on Saturday afternoon, was one of several airspace violations that day. NORAD safely escorted the aircraft out of the restricted zone, as it continues to safeguard North American airspace.

title: Arms from Myanmar: Smuggling racket in Manipur busted; 4 held as probe intensifies
description: Manipur police have uncovered a transnational arms smuggling operation following the arrest of a UNLF-P leader, exposing a network that trafficked weapons from Myanmar. The investigation revealed the group's violation of a ceasefire agreement, as they failed to surrender arms and continued criminal activities.

title: Evening news wrap: SC seeks ex-CJI Chandrachud’s removal from official residence; UK team in Kerala to repair stranded F-35B jet, and more
Mandi floods: Kangana hits out at Himachal govt over disaster handling; claims Congress won’t return to power for 20 years
description: Kangana Ranaut, BJP MP, visited her flood-stricken constituency of Mandi, Himachal Pradesh, and criticized the Congress party's relief efforts. She highlighted the extensive damage, including fatalities and missing persons, and emphasized her role in seeking central assistance. Ranaut defended her delayed arrival, citing road closures and advice from the Leader of the Opposition.

title: 'CO, SDM ko lagao pair dabane ke liye': Akhilesh Yadav mocks Yogi government over Kanwar Yatra row; says name-display order to hide incompetence
description: Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Uttar Pradesh government's handling of the Kanwar Yatra, suggesting officials should focus on providing food and health services to pilgrims. He mocked the directive for shopkeepers to display names, accusing the government of using QR codes to mask its failure to provide basic facilities like rest areas and food for the yatris.

title: ‘Great danger to democracy’: Mahua Moitra moves SC over EC's voter list revision in Bihar; calls it ‘crazy exercise to disenfranchise’
description: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has petitioned the Supreme Court against the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, alleging it disenfranchises millions, particularly migrant and poor voters, at the behest of the BJP. Moitra claims the process violates constitutional provisions and the Representation of People's Act, citing new document requirements that exclude common IDs.

title: Mandi cloudburst: Family dead or missing; 10-month-old baby might be the lone survivor
description: In a tragic turn of events, a cloudburst in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district has left a ten-month-old baby, Neetika, as the sole survivor of her family. Her father died trying to divert floodwater, while her mother and grandmother remain missing. Local authorities are providing assistance, and a bank account will be opened in Neetika's name to support her future.

title: Dalai Lama's 90th birthday: Rituals, VIPs in Dharamshala; highlights from celebration
description: The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, celebrated his 90th birthday in Dharamshala with monks, followers, and dignitaries, including representatives from the Indian government and international figures like Richard Gere. The Dalai Lama reflected on his life of service, while global leaders, including Prime Minister Modi and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, sent messages.

title: Why Bilawal Bhutto's Masood, Hafiz extradition offer is a sham - no power, no credibility, no trust; just a desperate bluff?
description: Amid strained relations, Pakistan's former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari surprisingly offered to extradite wanted terrorists if India cooperates legally. This comes after India put the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance, a crucial resource for Pakistan. Experts view Bhutto's statement with skepticism, citing Pakistan's history of betrayals and Bhutto's lack of executive authority.

title: Electoral roll revision:  EC eases rules for Bihar voters; 'required documents can be submitted later'
description: Amid opposition's 'votebandi' claims, the Election Commission has eased voter registration rules in Bihar. Voters can now submit forms without required documents initially, addressing concerns about potential disenfranchisement before upcoming elections. This follows opposition objections to the intensive electoral roll revision, fearing many voters could lose their right to vote.

title: 'Disneyland in Haryana?' Ex-Jet Airways CEO reacts to garbage laden streets of Gurugram, shares pictures
description: Former Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor criticised Gurugram’s civic mess, sharing images of garbage-filled streets and cows amid trash in sector 44. Calling the Haryana Disneyland plan “ludicrous,” he tagged local authorities and PM Modi, urging Swachh Bharat action. His posts sparked strong reactions from residents, echoing frustration over poor waste management and lack of basic civic upkeep.

title: 'Separate politics from language': 26/11 hero Praveen Teotia slams Thackerays over Marathi row; urges to not divide nation
description: Former navy commando Praveen Kumar Teotia, a 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks veteran, has criticized MNS chief Raj Thackeray and his party amidst a dispute over the Marathi language. Teotia questioned the absence of MNS warriors during the attacks, highlighting the contributions of people from UP and Bihar in saving lives.

title: Pune techie rape case: Top cop says 22-year-old woman filed false complaint; tried to portray city as unsafe
description: Pune Police have dismissed a rape allegation made by a 22-year-old data scientist as a fabrication intended to mislead authorities. Commissioner Amitesh Kumar stated the woman's report, claiming assault by a delivery agent, was false. Investigations revealed inconsistencies within 24 hours, including a manipulated selfie and a self-authored threatening message. The man in the selfie was known to her.

title: 208 kg gold, 30 types of ornaments, 5-hour spectacle: Jagannath Trinity to shine in Suna Besha on chariots, lakhs expected for golden darshan
New NMC rules expand faculty eligibility: 220-bed hospitals recognised teaching units; centre eyes 75,000 medical seats in 5 years
description: New National Medical Council rules allow doctors in government hospitals, even those without teaching affiliations, to become faculty in medical colleges. These regulations aim to address faculty shortages and support the expansion of medical seats nationwide. Relaxed bed requirements and recognition of experience in government institutions and related bodies further facilitate faculty appointments.

title: Union minister Nitin Gadkari asks Delhi Police to ‘strictly enforce’ ban on 2 & 3 wheelers on high-speed corridors
description: Union minister Nitin Gadkari has urged Delhi Police to strictly enforce the ban on two and three-wheelers on Delhi-NCR expressways due to rampant traffic violations and safety concerns. He also directed the removal of distracting hoardings and illegal advertisements from highways.

title: 'Not against Hindi, just its compulsion in schools': Sanjay Raut distances from Stalin's 'support'; clarifies Maharashtra's stand on language row
description: Sanjay Raut clarifies Shiv Sena (UBT)'s stance on Hindi, distinguishing it from Tamil Nadu's outright rejection. Maharashtra opposes mandatory Hindi in primary schools, not the language itself, unlike the southern state's broader resistance.

title: F-35B stranded in Kerala: 25 UK engineers arrive to repair $110 million fighter jet; grounded since June 14
description: A UK Royal Air Force Airbus A400M arrived in Kerala carrying aviation engineers to repair a stranded British F-35B Lightning fighter jet. The jet made an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport due to an engineering issue. The repair work will be carried out at the airport's MRO facility with support from Indian authorities and the Indian Air Force.

title: 'Road or school': Siddaramaiah aide asks public to choose between welfare schemes, development; opposition slams ‘freebie politics’
Beyond permitted period: Supreme Court seeks removal of ex-CJI Chandrachud from official residence 'without further delay'; writes to Centre
description: The Supreme Court administration has formally requested the Centre to reclaim the official residence of former CJI DY Chandrachud, as his permitted occupancy has exceeded the deadline.

title: IND vs ENG Live: Akash Deep breathes fire, India sniff historic win at Edgbaston
IND vs ENG: 'They can't win' - Former England captain wants a draw
description: Former England captain Michael Vaughan urges Ben Stokes' team to play for a draw in the Edgbaston Test, acknowledging India's dominance. Vaughan questions if England possesses the skill and mindset to bat through the final day, emphasizing that a draw is the best achievable outcome.

title: IND v ENG: Big milestone! Pant scripts SENA history with explosive knock
description: Rishabh Pant etched his name in cricket history, becoming the first Asian wicketkeeper-batter to surpass 2,000 Test runs in SENA countries. His aggressive 65 in the Edgbaston Test against England underscored his impact. Pant's Edgbaston innings also saw him break the record for most sixes by a visiting batter in England, with 24 sixes.

title: India vs England, Day 5 Weather Update: Rain likely to play spoilsport
description: The India versus England second Test match at Edgbaston faces weather concerns. Shubman Gill's impressive batting and Siraj and Akash Deep's bowling put India in a strong position. India needs to level the series. England requires a massive 608 runs to win. Rain is expected on Sunday, potentially affecting play and favoring seam bowlers. The match hangs in the balance.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England seamer on Akash Deep - 'He brings the stumps...'
description: Stuart Broad lauded Akash Deep's effectiveness on a challenging Edgbaston pitch, highlighting his ability to target the stumps and generate movement, even with the older ball. Broad emphasized Deep's strategic use of the crease to deceive batsmen, exemplified by Root's dismissal, and advised India to utilize him wisely with the new ball.

title: Youth ODIs: Inspired by Gill's knock , Suryavanshi eyes double ton in next match
description: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old prodigy, aims for a double century after smashing a record-breaking 52-ball century in a Youth ODI against England U-19. Inspired by Shubman Gill's Edgbaston double ton, Suryavanshi expressed his desire to bat the full 50 overs in the next game, focusing on maximizing his contribution to the team's success.

title: 'There's a Gill. There's a way' - Shubman follows double hundred with imperious 161
description: Shubman Gill's magnificent 161 propelled India to a dominant position against England in the Edgbaston Test. Gill's masterful innings, supported by Pant's aggressive 65 and Jadeja's solid batting, exhausted the English team. India set a massive target of 608, and England ended Day Four at 72/3, facing a daunting chase.

title: 'If he gets …': Shastri makes bold prediction as Suryavanshi slams fastest ton
description: Ravi Shastri has lauded 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, hinting at a possible fast-track to the Indian national team after his record-breaking 143 against England U-19. Suryavanshi's explosive innings, including the fastest Youth ODI century, has cemented his status as a generational talent. His prior IPL exploits further highlight his potential for rapid advancement in cricket.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test: Calm captain, fidgety deputy make for potent combo
description: Shubman Gill, now India's Test captain, and Rishabh Pant, his deputy, share a strong bond, evident in their impactful partnerships. Their chemistry on the field has led to significant stands, deflating opponents and solidifying their roles as key pillars in India's Test batting lineup.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Outbatted and outbowled England' - India deserve to win
description: Former England cricketers Nasser Hussain and Stuart Broad believe India deserves victory at Edgbaston, citing their dominance with both bat and ball throughout the Test. Hussain highlighted India's winning of more sessions and Akash Deep's impressive spell. Broad acknowledged India's superior bowling and batting performance, admitting his surprise at their strong recovery after the Headingley defeat.

title: IND vs ENG: Why he bothered opening ? Ex-England cricketer lauds Gill
description: Stuart Broad lauded Shubman Gill's exceptional performance at No. 4, questioning his earlier role as an opener. Gill's remarkable form as India's captain, including a century and a double century, has drawn high praise from Virat Kohli and Nasser Hussain. His elegant and chanceless innings highlight a bright future for Indian cricket.

title: IND vs ENG: Historic Test Heroics! All the records Shubman Gill set at Edgbaston
description: Shubman Gill dominated the Edgbaston Test with exceptional batting, setting numerous records, including the highest score by an Indian captain. His twin centuries powered India to a commanding position and placed him in an elite club of players with centuries in both innings. Gill's performance defined the match, etching his name in cricket history.

title: Historic First! India join fabled 1000-club, smash record for most runs in 1st two matches
description: Led by captain Shubman Gill Team India etched their name in Test cricket history at Edgbaston on Saturday, becoming the first Indian side to amass over 1,000 runs in a single match against England. This feat, only the sixth of its kind, saw India reach 1,014 runs, surpassing their previous best.

title: IND v ENG: Yashasvi Jaiswal fulfils wish of blind fan with sweet gesture | Watch
description: Young Ravi, a visually impaired cricket enthusiast, fulfilled his dream of meeting Indian opener Yashasvi Jaiswal at Edgbaston. Jaiswal, touched by Ravi's passion, gifted him his match bat as a memorable keepsake. Ravi also met England's Joe Root, receiving a signed jersey and gloves, making it an unforgettable day filled with joy and admiration for the sport.

title: Parisians take their first plunge into the Seine in more than a century
description: For the first time in more than 100 years, Parisians and tourists alike took a dive into the Seine on Saturday as three new swimming sites opened to the public. The long-forbidden waters are now officially open to the public, following a €1.4-billion cleanup project that paved the way for the open-water events at the Paris Olympics last year.

title: Controversial West African activist Kemi Seba detained in Paris
description: Kemi Seba, a controversial African activist known for his virulent anti-Western stance, has been arrested in Paris, a source close to the case told AFP Tuesday.

title: France’s new health pass rules raise questions as many scramble to adapt
description: While the extension of France’s health pass and other new anti-Covid 19 measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron Monday night are yet to be hammered out in detail, what’s certain is that a full-throttled return to a normal life of frequenting café terraces, restaurants, cinemas, theatres and other culture and leisure activities will now hinge on having a pass sanitaire (or health pass).

title: Daughter loses legal case in bitter Asterix family feud
description: A long-running family feud between Asterix co-creator Albert Uderzo and his daughter took a new twist on Tuesday after judges dismissed a claim by Sylvie Uderzo that her father was mentally frail and being exploited.

title: Sarkozy’s legal woes roll on despite court ruling
description: A probe into claims Nicolas Sarkozy received illegal funding for his successful 2007 presidential campaign has been dropped. But as he considers a political comeback, several other cases threaten serious damage to his reputation.

title: African troops march with French for Bastille Day
description: The famed military parade for Bastille Day on Paris’s Champs-Elysées Sunday featured African troops who assisted France in its Mali operation against Islamist rebels. However, some have criticised the African presence as a sign of neo-colonial ties.

title: French conservatives defeat far right in tight by-election
description: France’s conservative UMP party narrowly defeated the far-right National Front in a by-election on Sunday, with candidate Jean-Louis Costes (pictured) winning the seat vacated by disgraced Socialist MP Jérôme Cahuzac following a tax evasion scandal.

title: Record number of women and minorities in new French parliament
description: With more women and members of foreign descent than any previous National Assembly, France's newly-elected parliament has moved a step closer to mirroring French society, even as ethnic-minority groups demand more diversity in politics.

title: New poll gives Sarkozy first round election lead
description: An opinion poll for the first time Tuesday put French President Nicolas Sarkozy ahead of Socialist rival François Hollande for the April 22 first round of presidential elections but showed Hollande would win a run-off vote on May 6.

title: Socialist candidate drums up support in French tropics
description: Socialist presidential hopeful Francois Hollande and President Nicolas Sarkozy will both visit French overseas regions Martinique, Guadeloupe, and French Guiana in upcoming weeks, with Hollande kicking off the charm offensive first.

title: Violent protests have ‘weakened unions’ in retirement battle
description: As the French government gets closer to signing a law that will raise the retirement age in France from 60 to 62, a leading French labour expert says violent clashes between youths and police have undermined the unions’ position.

title: Left-wing alliance trumps Sarkozy’s party in regional polls
description: The ruling UMP party of President Nicolas Sarkozy experienced a wipeout in the second round of France’s regional elections, with the Socialists and their left-wing allies winning in all but one of mainland France's 22 regions.

title: French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal won't appeal sentence, hopes for pardon
description: French-Algerian writer Boualem Sansal will not appeal his five-year prison sentence, sources close to the author said on Saturday. French Prime Minister François Bayrou has said he hoped Algeria would pardon the author, who was arrested in November for saying France had unfairly ceded Moroccan territory to Algeria during the colonial era.

title: Top contemporary French artist Christian Boltanski dies aged 76
description: Christian Boltanski, one of France's top contemporary artists whose multimedia works probed the meaning of mortality and memory, has died aged 76, a former museum director told AFP on Sunday.

title: ‘France is your homeland’, Hollande tells French Jews
description: French President François Hollande announced tough new measures to combat anti-Semitism on Tuesday as he marked the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp with a visit to Paris's Holocaust memorial.

title: World leaders arrive in France for D-Day celebrations
description: Seventy years after the first Allied planes set off for the World War II invasion of Normandy, world leaders descended on France Thursday to remember the dead and commemorate D-Day in two days of memorial celebrations.

title: French court drops probe into Sarkozy campaign cash
description: A French court on Monday dropped a formal investigation into illegal campaign financing by former president Nicolas Sarkozy, who had been under investigation since March for allegedly accepting funds from L'Oréal heiress Liliane Bettencourt.

title: US consultant admits role in France's 'Karachi affair'
description: A US political consultant has admitted being paid by an intermediary in 1994 arms sales for advising the campaign of French presidential hopeful Édouard Balladur. The admission may shed new light on the scandal known as the “Karachi affair”.

title: French far-right shames Socialists in by-election
description: The far-right National Front has moved on to the second round of a parliamentary by-election to replace disgraced former MP Jérôme Cahuzac. The victory is an embarrassing blow to the Socialist government of President François Hollande.

title: Greens secure ‘historic’ gains in French parliamentary poll
description: France’s Green party won 17 seats in the country’s general election Sunday, an unprecedented score that makes it prominent enough to form its own parliamentary group, giving it more clout in political decision-making.

title: 'Lust’ is not a crime, say Strauss-Kahn lawyers
description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn’s lawyers have said their client, placed under formal investigation Monday for alleged involvement in a prostitution ring, was being hounded for “the offence of lust” which is “not forbidden in the penal code”.

title: Who will be France’s next first lady, or gentleman?
description: A singer, a journalist, a housewife or a plasterer’s son: who will move into the Elysée Palace in May, and can candidates count on their partners to help them get there? FRANCE 24 takes a look at who might be France’s next first lady… or gentleman.

title: Who's on strike in France?
description: Numerous industry sectors have joined the growing strikes against French President Nicolas Sarkozy’s unpopular pension reforms. Here are the sectors causing the most disruption.

title: Roma expulsion orders called into question by lawyers
description: In the Parisian suburb of Montreuil, 14 Roma men were ordered to leave French territory after a police roundup in August. Lawyers say their case proves the government is behind a discriminatory and illegal policy of expulsions.

title: Left-leaning parties form alliance to keep lead in second round
description: Ahead of a March 21 run-off vote, France’s Socialists allied with the Greens and other left leaning parties in a deal struck on Tuesday following the Socialists’ first-place showing in round one of regional elections.

title: In search for French heroes, Macron blunders – again
description: France’s embattled leader saw a week of World War I commemorations as a chance to reconnect with the French and highlight the danger of nationalism. Instead, his comments about Marshal Pétain gave further evidence of his tendency to shock and dismay.

title: France makes 323 arrests since start of Euro 2016 championship
description: French police have made 323 arrests since the start of the European Championships, the interior ministry said on Thursday, as Europe's showcase football event continues to be marred by violence.

title: Sarkozy ensnared in Bettencourt scandal
description: Former president Nicolas Sarkozy will remain under formal investigation in a case involving suspected illegal campaign donations by France’s richest woman, Liliane Bettencourt, after judges dismissed a motion to throw out a key medical report.

title: French ministers disclose personal wealth for first time
description: French authorities published the personal wealth of ministers on the government website on Monday in a bid to restore public confidence following a tax-evasion scandal which led to the resignation of former budget minister Jérôme Cahuzac.

title: Socialists free to push through reform agenda
description: The resounding Socialist Party victory in Sunday's parliamentary elections will allow new French President François Hollande to follow through with promised economic reforms to stimulate growth across Europe, a senior minister said Monday.

title: Integration to emigration: Why do migrants leave Germany?
description: Germany promises opportunity and stability — yet many migrants feel overlooked and excluded. As more consider leaving, their stories point not only to policy gaps, but the need for a deeper societal shift.

title: Germany updates: Thousands join Cologne's CSD parade
description: The western German city has been preparing for this year's Pride event with some 60,000 participants expected. Meanwhile, Pride events also took place in eastern Germany, amid far-right protests. Follow DW for more.

title: UN criticizes Germany over plans to deport people to Afghanistan
description: Germany’s Interior Minister has said he is open to creating a direct line with the Taliban to enable deportations of Afghans living in Germany. The UN has criticized the plan.

title: Germany's Green Party struggling to establish new identity
description: The Greens lost the German election and are no longer part of the government. Now, they want to reposition themselves — and to listen more closely to what the people have to say.

title: Germany's monasteries and convents dying out
description: The number of people in monastic orders in Germany is sinking, with many convents and monasteries facing dissolution. But what happens to the buildings, traditions, and the communities they once housed?

title: Euro 2025: Germany win but Gwinn injury casts shadow
description: A stunning strike from Jule Brand helped Germany to a winning start at Euro 2025. The 2-0 win over Poland was not as straightforward as many imagined though, and another knee injury to captain Giulia Gwinn is a concern.

title: Will Germany's military spending spree deliver broad economic growth?
description: The German arms industry is thriving thanks to a major state-run investment program. But will the country's wider economy benefit?

title: Felize dances and parties in Berlin's famous Berghain in her wheelchair. How can German clubs practice inclusion?
description: Felize dances and parties in Berghain in her wheelchair. How can clubs practice inclusion aside from having awareness teams and wheelchair ramps?

title: Turkey ramps up political influence in the Western Balkans
description: Turkey hopes to expand its influence by investing in infrastructure and religious landmark buildings across the Western Balkans. Building mosques are part and parcel of Ankara's geopolitical agenda, observers say.

title: Afghanistan: Russia recognizes the Taliban government
description: Russia has become the first country in the world to formally recognize Afghanistan's Taliban government. This improves the radical group's standing on the world stage, and puts pressure on the West to follow suit.

title: London police chief calls for 'mega' forces to cut costs
description: The head of the Metropolitan Police has called for dozens of police forces in England and Wales to be merged into 12-15 regional giants. Mark Rowley says the savings made could be used for new crime-fighting technology.

title: Ozzy Osbourne and Black Sabbath put on one last show
description: On July 5, Ozzy Osbourne reunited with Black Sabbath in his hometown of Birmingham for a farewell concert. Here's a look at the wild life of the "Prince of Darkness," including the time he bit the head off a bat.

title: Texas flood death toll hits 50 as search intensifies
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has issued a disaster declaration. The severe flooding left dozens of people dead and several others missing — many from a girls' summer camp.

title: Dalai Lama celebrates 90th birthday amid succession debate
description: Thousands of Tibetan Buddhists are celebrating the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday. The spiritual leader has said that he hopes to live for 30 to 40 years more.

title: Australia: PM denounces synagogue arson attack
description: A man doused the door of the building in Melbourne and set it alight while 20 worshippers were inside.

title: Rising death toll in Texas floods as children remain missing
description: The death toll from the floods in central Texas has risen to 43. Authorities in the US state confirmed that more than 20 children who attended the Camp Mystic summer camp were still missing.

title: Elon Musk launches new America Party
description: Musk's new party might focus on picking up House and Senate seats in the midterm elections next year. He is not the first person trying to break the United States' two-party system.

title: Fleeing, injured, and forgotten: Migrants in Poland's border forest
description: For four years now, Poland has taken drastic measures to stop refugees from entering the EU across its border with Belarus. The humanitarian consequences are dire. DW spent a day with the activists who try to help them.
